p: As can be seen in Figure 1 and Figure 2, and as summarized in Table 2 and Table 3, all of these essential oils inhibited the growth of these two fungi in a dose-dependent manner. The greatest inhibitory activity was shown by the C.cit essential oil, with 100% inhibition of mycelial growth of both A. alternata and S. cucurbitacearum reached at 0.6 mg/mL and 0.9 mg/mL, respectively ( Table 2). A. alternata was generally more sensitive to these essential oils than S. cucurbitacearum, and at 1 mg/mL essential oils, its mycelia growth was inhibited by 55.0%, 71.5%, 68.2%, 36.1%, 74.2%, and 90.5% by L.dent, L.hyb, M.alt, L.nob, O.maj1, and O.maj2, respectively ( Table 2). At the same essential oil concentration, S. cucurbitacearum radial growth was inhibited by 73.5%, 74.0%, 73.7%, 65.3%, 60.0%, and 67.3%, respectively ( Table 3). The positive control of the fungicide combination of 25 g/L difenoconazole plus 25 g/L fludioxonil completely inhibited the mycelial growth of A. alternata at all concentrations tested. Against S. cucurbitacearum, this fungicide combination at 0.1, 0.5, and 1 mg/mL inhibited the mycelial growth by 75.7%, 84.9%, and 86.7%, respectively.
